alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 6:22PM CDT until June 21 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, McCulloch. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 620 PM CDT, Storms have ended in southern Mcculloch county. Up to 1.25 inches of rain have fallen, south of Brady. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp San Saba and Voca. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1851 crossing Tiger Creek, County Road 216 crossing Mud Creek and County Road 212 crossing San Saba River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
